author: potuz
content: Say you need to create an IL for the next payload. You receive a payload right now, validate it and you find out it's OK. Now your mempool tells you that you have two transactions, A and B that have the right nonce, balance and gas_limit for the current base fee. Problem is that transaction A invalidates tx B. Either we allow them both in the IL (and then the attesters for the next payload will do the runtime check to realize that B could not have been included in fact) or we execute them now to find out that B cannot be included and therefore we don't put them in the IL.

author: terencechain
content: My understanding of Focil is that TX invalidation can only happen on the construction side, not on the verification side. Yes, this means more work and complication for IL construction or IL_agg construction. Hence, having an EVAL function to determine the quality of the IL aggregate is crucial. One thing that I don't think was mentioned is what happens if an IL member submits an invalid IL.
